text: Deals more damage than by hand.
Used to dig dirt, grass, sand, gravel and snow faster than by hand.
Required to mine stone-related blocks and ore.
Used to chop wood-related blocks faster than by hand.
Used to till dirt and grass blocks to prepare for crops.
Wooden doors are activated by using, hitting them or with Redstone.
Iron doors can only be opened by Redstone, buttons or switches.
Gives the user 1.5 Armor when worn.
Gives the user 4 Armor when worn.
Gives the user 3 Armor when worn.
Gives the user 1.5 Armor when worn.
A shiny ingot which can be used to craft tools made from this material.
Used as an expensive building block or compact storage of the ore.
Used to send an electrical charge when stepped on by a player, an animal, or a monster. Wooden Pressure Plates can also be activated by dropping something on them.
Used to create light. Torches also melt snow and ice.
Used as a building material and can be crafted into many things.
Is not influenced by gravity like normal Sand.
Used to craft torches, arrows, signs, ladders, fences and as handles for tools and weapons.
Used to sleep until dawn. Changes your spawn point to the bed's position.
Allows you to craft a more varied selection of items than the normal crafting.
Allows you to smelt ore, create charcoal and glass, and cook fish and porkchops.
Used as a barrier that cannot be jumped over.
Work like normal doors, but are a one by one block and lay flat on the ground.
Shows text entered by you or other players.
Used to create brighter light than torches. Melts snow/ice and can be used underwater.
Used to cause explosions. Activated after placing by hitting, or with an electrical charge.
Used to hold mushroom stew, beetroot soup. You keep the bowl when the stew has been eaten.
Used to hold and transport water, lava and milk.
Displays positions of the Sun and Moon.
Creates an image of an area explored while held. This can be used for path-finding.
Allows for ranged attacks by using arrows.
Restores 0.5 Hearts. Can be stacked up to 8 times.
Restores 1.5 Hearts. Can be used 6 times.
Used to send an electrical charge by being turned on or off. Stays in the on or off state until pressed again.
Constantly sends an electrical charge, or can be used as a receiver/transmitter when connected to the side of a block.[note 1]
Used in Redstone circuits as repeater, a delayer, and/or a diode
Used to send an electrical charge by being pressed. Stays activated for approximately a second before shutting off again.
Used to hold and shoot out items in a random order when given a Redstone charge.
Plays a note when triggered. Hit it to change the pitch of the note. Placing this on top of different blocks changes the type of instrument.
When powered, accelerates minecarts that pass over it. When unpowered, causes minecarts to stop on it.[note 2]
Functions like a Pressure Plate (sends a Redstone signal when powered) but can only be activated by a minecart.
Used to transport you, an animal, or a monster along rails.
Used to transport goods along rails.
Moves along rails and can push other minecarts when coal is put in it.
Used to travel in water more quickly than swimming.
Collected from sheep, and can be colored with dyes.
Used as a building material and can be colored with dyes. Can be easily obtained from Sheep.
Used as a dye to create black wool.
Used as a dye to create green wool.
Used as a dye to create brown wool.
Used as a dye to create silver wool.
Used as a dye to create yellow wool.
Used as a dye to create red wool.
Used to instantly grow crops and flowers. Can be used in dye recipes.
Used as a dye to create pink wool.
Used as a dye to create orange wool.
Used as a dye to create lime wool.
Used as a dye to create gray wool.
Used as a dye to create light gray wool.[note 3]
Used as a dye to create light blue wool.
Used as a dye to create cyan wool.
Used as a dye to create purple wool.
Used as a dye to create magenta wool.
Used as dye to create Blue Wool.
Use these to create very strong tools, weapons or armor
Use these to create very strong tools, weapons or armor
Used to create brighter light than torches. Melts snow/ice and can be used underwater.[note 4]
Used to create books and maps.
Can be mined with an iron pickaxe or better, then smelted in a furnace to produce gold ingots.
Can be mined with a stone pickaxe or better, then smelted in a furnace to produce iron ingots.
Can be mined with a pickaxe to collect coal.
Can be mined with a stone pickaxe or better to collect lapis lazuli.
Can be mined with an iron pickaxe or better to collect diamonds.
Can be mined with an iron pickaxe or better to collect redstone dust.
Can be mined with a pickaxe to collect cobblestone.
Collected using a shovel. Can be used for construction.
Can be planted and it eventually grows into a tree.
Sets fire to anything that touches it. Can be collected in a bucket.
Collected using a shovel. Can be smelted into glass using the furnace. Is affected by gravity if there is no other tile underneath it.
Collected using a shovel. Sometimes produces flint when dug up. Is affected by gravity if there is no other tile underneath it.
Chopped using an axe, and can be crafted into planks or used as a fuel.
Created in a furnace by smelting sand. Breaks when attempting to mine it.
Breaks when attempting to mine it.
Mined from stone using a pickaxe. Can be used to construct a furnace or stone tools.
Baked from clay in a furnace.
Can be baked into bricks in a furnace.
A compact way to store snowballs.
Can be dug with a shovel to create snowballs.
Can be crafted into a dye.
Can be crafted with a bowl to make stew.
Can only be mined with a diamond pickaxe. Is produced by the meeting of water and still lava, and is used to build a portal.
Is placed on the ground to carry an electrical charge.
When fully grown, crops can be harvested to collect wheat.
Ground that has been prepared ready to plant seeds.
Can be crafted to create a dye.
Can be crafted to create sugar.
Can be worn as a helmet or crafted with a torch to create a Jack-O-Lantern.
Slows the movement of anything walking over it.
Standing in the portal allows you to pass between the overworld and the nether.
Restores health, and can be crafted into a golden apple.
Can be broken into melon slices.
Used as a fuel in a furnace, or crafted to make a torch.
Used as a renewable fuel in a furnace, or crafted to make a torch.
Collected by killing a spider, and can be crafted into a bow.
Collected by killing a chicken, and can be crafted into an arrow.
Collected by killing a creeper, and can be crafted into TNT.
Used to obtain wool from sheep and to harvest placeable Leaf blocks.
Can be planted in farmland to grow crops.
Harvested from crops, and can be used to craft food items.
Collected by digging gravel, and can be used to craft a flint and steel.
Collected by killing a pig, and can be cooked in a furnace. Restores health.
Created by cooking a porkchop in a furnace. Restores health.
Collected by killing a cow, and can be cooked in a furnace. Restores health.
Created by cooking a beef in a furnace. Restores health.
Collected by killing a chicken, and can be cooked in a furnace. Restores health.
Created by cooking a chicken in a furnace. Restores health.
When used on a pig it allows you to ride the pig.
Collected by digging snow, and can be thrown.
Collected by killing a cow, and can be crafted into armor.
Dropped randomly by chickens, and can be crafted into food items.
Collected by mining Glowstone, and can be crafted to make Glowstone blocks again.
Can be eaten to restore health, or cooked in a furnace.
Created by cooking a raw fish in a furnace. Can be eaten to restore health.
Collected by killing a skeleton. Can be crafted into bone meal.
Collected by getting a skeleton to kill a creeper. Can be played in a jukebox.
Can be dyed to make blocks of various colors.
Extinguishes fire and helps crops grow. Can be collected in a bucket.
When broken sometimes drops a sapling which can then be replanted to grow into a tree.
Can be used for construction and decoration.
Is a stone material from the Nether.
Construction block made from Nether bricks.
Used to form blocks of Nether bricks.
Quartz from the Nether, used to create Blocks of Quartz.
Decorative block, used to create other kinds of Quartz blocks.
Can be used to make pumpkin pie and laterns [sic].
Eat them, plant them or bake them.
Made by cooking a potato, can be eaten to restore health.
Can be cut up and eaten.[note 5]
A seethrough thin wall. Great for locking out things.
Used as decoration. A compact way to store Wheat.
Can be used in a furnace and is a compact way of storing coal.
Can be eaten or turned into beetroot soup or red dye.
Powered rail that boosts minecarts driving over them.
Thin wool carpet that makes your floors more colorful.
Crafting descriptions are now shown in the furnace UI.
Crafting descriptions are no longer visible in the crafting table or stonecutter.

texts.text: This article is about the descriptions shown in Pocket Edition. For their Legacy Console Edition equivalents, see Legacy Console Edition descriptions.
In alpha builds of Pocket Edition, crafting interfaces held descriptions for the item to be crafted.
Below is a table of all item descriptions. Descriptions for uncraftable items also appear to exist despite not having anywhere to be displayed.

The following text is listed in the line below this one in en_US.lang:
Can also be used for low-level lighting.
Powered rails use the desc.goldenrail string below.

Light gray dye uses the desc.dyepowder.silver string above. The following text is listed in the line below this one in en_US.lang:
(Note: light gray dye can also be made by combining gray dye with bone meal, letting you make four light gray dyes from every ink sac instead of three.)
Jack o'lanterns use the desc.litpumpkin string below.
Melon blocks use the desc.melon string above.
Jungle wood stairs are listed twice in en_US.lang.
Cobblestone walls attempted to take their crafting description from desc.tile.cobbleWall, which did not exist.
